018package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc;
019
020import static java.lang.System.out;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.Common.parseNameAndEmail;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
024
025import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
026import java.util.EnumSet;
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.Set;
029
030import org.apiguardian.api.API;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
032import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
033import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet;
034
035/**
036 *  {@summary This taglet replaces the standard {@code @author} taglet. It is
037 *  different in the way that it provides the author's email address as a
038 *  hyperlink.}<br>
039 *  <br>This means that the tag requires the reference to the author in the
040 *  format below:<br>
041 *  <pre><code>  &#x40;extauthor &lt;<i>name</i>&gt; <b>-</b> &lt;<i>email address</i>&gt;</code></pre>
042 *  Basically, this is the name of the author, followed by their email address,
043 *  separated by a hyphen (&quot;&#x2d;&quot; or &amp;#x2d;), surrounded by
044 *  blanks.<br>
045 *  <br>If there is no email address, the output is the same as for the
046 *  standard {@code @author} taglet.
047 *
048 *  @note   Previously (before Java&nbsp;15), it was possible to
049 *      &quot;overwrite&quot; the default {@code @author} tag by a custom
050 *      implementation. Unfortunately, this does not work any longer: when
051 *      providing a custom tag with the same name, no author is added to the
052 *      output at all.
053 *
054 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
055 *  @version $Id: AuthorTaglet.java 821 2020-12-31 00:05:27Z tquadrat $
056 *  @since 0.0.5
057 *
058 *  @UMLGraph.link
059 */
060@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: AuthorTaglet.java 821 2020-12-31 00:05:27Z tquadrat $" )
061@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
062public final class AuthorTaglet implements Taglet
063{
064        /*-----------*\
065    ====** Constants **========================================================
066        \*-----------*/
067    /**
068     *  The name of this taglet: {@value}.
069     */
070    public static final String TAGLET_NAME = "extauthor";
071
072        /*--------------*\
073    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
074        \*--------------*/
075    /**
076     *  Creates a new {@code AuthorTaglet} instance.
077     */
078    @SuppressWarnings( "RedundantNoArgConstructor" )
079    public AuthorTaglet() { /* Just exists */ }
080
081        /*---------*\
082    ====** Methods **==========================================================
083        \*---------*/
084    /**
085     *  {@inheritDoc}
086     */
087    @Override
088    public final Set<Location> getAllowedLocations() { return EnumSet.allOf( Location.class ); }
089
090    /**
091     *  {@inheritDoc}
092     *
093     *  @see jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet#getName()
094     */
095    @Override
096    public final String getName() { return TAGLET_NAME; }
097
098    /**
099     *  {@inheritDoc}
100     */
101    @Override
102    public final boolean isInlineTag() { return false; }
103
104    /**
105     *  {@inheritDoc}
106     */
107    @Override
108    public final String toString( final List<? extends DocTree> tags, final Element element )
109    {
110        final var caption = tags.size() > 1 ? "Authors" : "Author";
111        final var template =
112            """
113
114            <dt><span class="simpleTagLabel">%1$s:</span></dt>
115              <dd>%2$s</dd>
116            """;
117        final var retValue = format( template, caption, parseNameAndEmail( this, tags ) );
118
119        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
120        return retValue;
121    }   //  toString()
122}
123//  class AuthorTaglet
124
125/*
126 *  End of File
127 */
